title: DataPoint
description: Describes the format of data that is used by the by the data flow system.

id.title: ID
id.description: A unique identifier that for the data point.

tid.title: Tenant ID
tid.description: The ID of the tenant this data point belongs to

shape.title: Shape
shape.description: The shape that defines this data point

sid.title: Source ID
sid.description: The ID of the source that generated this data point

jid.title: Job ID
jid.description: The ID of the job that generated this data point

bid.title: Batch ID
bid.description: The ID of the batch that generated this data point

rid.title: Record ID
rid.description: A value that unique represents the record contained in the data point

cid.title: Correlation ID
cid.description: A value used to track the data point's movement through the system. (Should be an xid)

data.title: Data
data.description: The actual data payload of this data point. May be a record or one of the alternative types, based on the 'type' field.

trc.title: Trace
trc.description: Trace information used for monitoring latency. This will only be populated on a fraction of data points.

Record.description: Record is an object containing arbitrary data. It is used when the type is 'ins', 'ups', or 'del'

BadRecord.description: BadRecord represents a record that had some problem at some step. The data point should be propegated but no step should attempt any further processing.

originalType.description: The original type, before something went wrong.

originalRecord.description: The original record that was emitted.

errorStep.description: Something that identifies the step where the problem happend.

problems.description: Problems that individual properties in the record had.

Trace.description: A trace records stats for a step that a data point has gone through.

ts.title: Timestamp
ts.description: Timestamp indicating when the step started.

d.title: Duration
d.description: The time it took to complete the step, in nanoseconds.

Start.description: Start indicates a job has started. It is associated with the type 'stt'.

count.title: Expected count
count.description: Optional; the number of records expected in this job, if it can be predicted.

rate.title: Expected rate
rate.description: Optional; the maximum number of milliseconds expected between data points or heartbeats. If the rate is provided the receiver will be able to detect timeouts more accurately.

willNotEnd.title: Will not end
willNotEnd.description: If true, this job is expected to run until it is stopped. Timeout monitoring may still be applied if 'rate' is set.

End.description: End indicates a job has ended. It is associated with the type 'end'.

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of records the job thinks it sent, so that receivers can detect data loss.

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: Specifies the reason the job ended.

message.title: Message
message.description: A message about why the job ended. Usually only relevent if the job failed.

Heartbeat.description: A tracer used for monitoring latency and providing a keep-alive heartbeat for long-running jobs.
